env_param._comment: choose Alma instance : 'sb' for sandbox env or 'prod' for production

inst_param._comment: choose Alma institution : 'sp' for Sciences et Patrimoines or 'elp' for Ecoles et Lecture Publique

file_param._comment: if file in execution folder don't change value of XMLfile_path, else give path : for example 'C:/Users/username/Documents'

rules_param._comment: normalization rules id to apply in Alma ('nz' = Network zone, 'iz' = Institution zone) : put process ID, example in sp sandbox '102793104110002851'

_comment.update_method1: 2. add field if same field with same subfields doesn't exist, don't check indicators, example : will add whole field '985 $$2 test $$a 980' even if '985 $$2 vdbcul $$a 980' already exists
_comment.update_method2: 3. check in every existing field if subfield exist before to add, with same example as before : will only add '$$2 test' in existing 985
_comment.subfields: add each subfields between [] with comma separator. If yon want to get all subfields, use keyword 'all'

_comment.regex4: if not replacement for cotation in holding, use empty quotes

_comment.bool: if 2nd cotation (852 $$j in holding), put True, else False
_comment.item_cote: if True, 1st and 2nd cotation must be in item alternative_call_number : example 'cote1|cote2'

check_duplicates._comment: True or False if no value is accepted or not

_comment.id_type: for 'id_type' choose between 'iz_id', 'nz_id', '035' or 'empty' if no check needed on existing Alma bib recrod
_comment.identifier: identifier is optional, usefull to specify xpath of tag given in id_type, if not necessary use empty quotes
_comment.multi_prefix: multi_prefix is used to specify different prefixes that id_type might have in Alma, if not necessary use empty quotes
_comment.multi_prefix1: !! if used first value must be prefix used in XMLfile and use pipe as separator '|', example : (HEMUCL)edoc|(HEMUCL)fa|(HEMUCL)book !!
